website_summaries.verdict: An extremely popular pull-out sink. Budget priced.
cons: Plain design won't appeal to some
Flow rate is too high for California regulations

customer_reviews.title: Brushed Nickel installed directly on stainless steel sink
customer_reviews.text: The plumber just left after installing this faucet so I am just giving my first impression and can't yet speak to durability. My plumber was not particularly impressed since he said that most faucets come with their own compression hoses and this model did not. I wondered how this brushed nickel would look installed directly on stainless steel since none of the product pictures showed that configuration. It matches quite nicely and I have attached a couple of pictures showing that. I do like how it swivels easily and the hose attachment fits well in the faucet base. The spray feature does stop if the water flow is too low and the flow reverts back to stream when turned off.
customer_reviews.author: Bichon Mom

customer_reviews.title: A nice looking inexpensive kitchen sink faucet.
customer_reviews.text: Generally speaking trying to uninstall an old kitchen sink faucet and then install the new one is not easy. No matter what model. Crawling under the sink, reaching up to where the items are fastened, you definitely need a basin wrench. But, once you get it done and properly tightened and the faucet and handle all properly lined up (a bit of a challenge, but that would be true for any model) it's a very nice faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Rowbear

customer_reviews.title: The good: Handle can be lifted up and down by ...
customer_reviews.text: Too early to tell its durability yet, but my feedback so far... The good: Handle can be lifted up and down by a figure to control flows. Swivels freely left and right. Body is all metal. The so so: Very light weight which makes it feel flimsy. Even securely fastened, the body rocks slightly. Hot/cold lines not clearly labeled - had to guess which was which during installation. The spray button is hidden in a rubber boot (why?), making it hard to operate with one hand. None of the flaws is a deal breaker, but I am on the fence to say I will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: ZL

customer_reviews.title: Very good performance; very slightly off-center
customer_reviews.text: This is a superbly performing faucet for the price. I installed it myself with the deck plate several months ago and we've had no problems whatsoever. Faucet in brushed nickel looks very nice, no imperfections. Installation went smoothly. Handle works well: water shuts on/off completely and volume/temperature control is smooth. No leaks anywhere. Switch between central water stream and multi-stream spray is easy and works well. Sprayer sits well into its holder; could be a more solid fit but not a problem. The one minor drawback is that the swiveling cylinder that the facet comes out of is slightly off-center from the short bottom cylinder, but I think that's only noticeable to me because I'm the one who installed it.
customer_reviews.author: GEF

customer_reviews.title: It is too bad as it was great at first
customer_reviews.text: After Using it a few weeks I am not sure why but it starting to swivel with too much friction. Looking at it carefully I noticed that the base was not aligned with the body anymore. I have not had it apart yet as I will get a new faucet first to replace it. It is too bad as it was great at first. It seems to be a weak plastic core that has broken but I will post an update once disassembled.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Tested and Upgraded
customer_reviews.text: Not certain yet that I like the pull-out feature, and the water flow seems too constrained (too slow). And the slanted aim of the faucet, meaning that it doesn't flow straight down toward the drain, is still the key thing to me. (In use for about 2 months.) Update, 2 months later, showing quotes from my earlier review ===> The "slanted aim of the faucet" is actually better than "straight down". In fact, the faucet rating is now moved from 3-star to 5-star. My previous concern that the water flow rate is "slow" is now offset due to the very effective spraying of water flowing through it... I mean the built-in spray, with the optional super-spray switched off.
customer_reviews.author: jasmansr

customer_reviews.title: Great Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I have had this faucet since 2011. The plastic that covers the toggle switch on the spray head finally disintegrated leaving the switch exposed. Premier has a limited lifetime warranty. I called the toll free number 1-866-745-4010 and told them (i was hoping I could buy a replacement ). They're sending me a brand new sprayer head. Can't beat that!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Seemed Great At First But Turns Off On Its Own 1 Year Later
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this faucet about a year and a half ago. At first I liked it, however over the past year it has developed an issue where if it is on a low flow it turns off, the handle goes down on its own. This problem developed over the course of a few months, I'd understand if it was 10 or 20 years old but not a few months in.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 18 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this faucet about 18 months ago. It worked great until a couple weeks ago. Now, it feels like the works are getting worn out. The handle is sticky and sort of drags when I turn on/of the water. The price is reasonable, so maybe it was worth the cost. I'll be replacing it soon and may try a different brand next time. I'm not sure a faucet that costs more will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Mile-Hi

customer_reviews.title: Leaking!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Installation was okay...some points were missed. For example, teflon tape included, but no guidance on when to use it. HOWEVER--it's leaking, big-time, from the base of the sprayer head. Contacted Premier, we'll see what they say! It's a pain to spend all this time installing and have the very last step go badly. Updated, 25 May--Premier sent us a new sprayer head. Unscrewed the leaky one, replaced it with the new one, now works great. I'm a lot happier!
customer_reviews.author: Mik

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet, good price
customer_reviews.text: I prefer a single-handled faucet with pullout sprayer and this one with the brushed steel finish was an elegant replacement for the previous two-handle faucet I had with a separate sprayer. It seems to be performing as well as the more expensive Kohler faucet with similar features that we had in a previous home. I took a chance on it, because Consumer Reports said all faucets perform so well these days they've stopped rating them. My husband particularly likes the feature on this one that switches the sprayer to full stream each time you turn the water off, as that is easier than finding the right place to push the off button on the sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Kim C. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.....
customer_reviews.text: we loved this faucet, at first. Now after using it for 5 months, it will not say ON. No matter the position, it turns itself off. At first we thought this would help with water usage, but now it is just annoying. I cannot wait until we buy another and I can beat the crap out of this thing with a hammer in the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Debra W

customer_reviews.title: I had the stainless steel version for three years. Stainless Steel finish wears off showing chrome underneath
customer_reviews.text: I had the stainless steel version for three years. The stainless steel is a faux coating over a chrome finish. The coating is wearing off and I am replacing with an all chrome KOHLER K-15160-CP. I really like this faucet, except for the finish. No problems except for the peeling of the finish. FYI, If you have a leak at he wand, tighten the hose to wand. I am going 100 percent chrome on all my fixtures. Chrome plating over brass is the longest wearing finish
customer_reviews.author: Spridle

customer_reviews.title: Best faucet I've owned by a landside
customer_reviews.text: All faucets should be made like this one. - It swivels with no resistance. - The hose retracts with no issues (assuming you install the weight correctly). - The fittings are solid. One feature I really like (that would annoy my mother) is that when you shut it off, it always reverts to the "stream" setting (as opposed to staying on spray). I find it irritating to be surprised by a sudden forceful spray of water. You need to keep the flow relatively high to keep it spraying. If you don't do this, it'll revert to a stream.
customer_reviews.author: B. Martin

customer_reviews.title: sprayer degraded after a year
customer_reviews.text: After a year it started converting itself from solid flow to the sprayer, permanently with no way to switch it back to solid flow. Now it also started leaking out of the faucet when spraying, which takes some water away from the spray, and this leaking is slowly increasing every week that goes by.
customer_reviews.author: James Hannum

customer_reviews.title: works well, all required parts included
customer_reviews.text: Installation instructions were clear, and easy-to-follow, even with no prior plumbing experience. All required parts were included - my existing plumbing connections fit without the need for any adapters. Conveniently, it included a cover for the hole where my sprayer used to be. My previous faucet was the type with a sprayer as a separate unit on the side. That sprayer had too little pressure to be very useful, so I never used it. I didn't expect I'd care about the pull-out feature of this faucet, but it really is great to have all the power of the normal faucet with a hose attached.
customer_reviews.author: jefff

customer_reviews.title: the faucet looks good. Some people did complain about the instructions
customer_reviews.text: You really can't beat this faucet for the price. I installed it myself and the necessary parts were included. You will need to provide your own flex hose and this unit uses the standard size. My only complaint after a few months of use is that the pullout part of the faucet is a bit loose in the fitting and does not seem to fully seat in the base. However, it does not affect function. Overall, the faucet looks good. Some people did complain about the instructions, but I did not find them difficult. Getting the old unit out was the hardest part.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good reviews but not 2.2 gpm
customer_reviews.text: Frustrated because description clearly states 2.2 gpm. Upon inspection, stamp on faucet shows 1.8 gpm. 1.8 gpm is what I am trying to replace after only 3 months of use. Understand water conservation but it just doesn't make sense having to take triple the time to perform the same task using the same amount of water, rinse out the sink, fill the coffee pot..... Wish my original faucet could have been repaired.
customer_reviews.author: K C

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely a winner!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy to have found this online! The faucet I replaced was the same style, which was a fifteen year old white one, so it was difficult to find. This style is smaller and simpler than most you find in the stores these days. It seems the trend is big and overdone (and crazy expensive) which is not at all what I wanted or needed. I have designed my kitchen with polished nickel hardware, so finding this in nickel was quite a nice surprise! I am a 68 year old woman, but I even installed it myself and it was very easy. I even found a perfect under sink soap dispenser to match. Fabulous upgrade! Made my year!
customer_reviews.author: kat erickson

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Faucet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this faucet for my kitchen sink and it works great! The water flows smooth and it feels sturdy. I bought a matching soap dispenser made by Premier and it looks great along with it. I had a plumber at house and he installed this in no time. Would highly recommend in comparison to Moen, Delta, and Koehler. Do not buy Aquasource as they will lock up on you! I will update review 6-12 months later if there any faults.
customer_reviews.author: ATLien318

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed I think is a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Seems very well constructed and valve feel nice and snugged when actuating it or the arm swivels, good fit when placing the pull out head back in the faucet and stays in place, slightly short for my double basin sink and have the stream of water a little close to the center inside corner on either side. I don't like that the head is always in the jet mode, after pushing the button and using the spray mode it will go back to jet on it's own when water is shut off. After a month of use so far so good and I think will last for years. Think was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Lost all of my water pressure with the small feed lines, takes twice as long to fill a water pitcher. ordered 2.2 gpm faucet received 1.8 gpm ( label on box ) did test myself less than 1.5 gpm
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I had this faucet for just 5 months and today I went to pull out the handle and it came off and water shoot across the room of 10 feet. I tuned it off and tried to put it back together and there is no way it can be fixed. Had a plumber look at it, and he said that there seems to be a missing part that holds the spray connection to the faucet. It looks to me like this is one of the disposable types, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. DeHart

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: We had a plumber install it for us. I worked ok for 3 weeks, then suddenly water started running from the top and base of the faucet. The plumber came back and took it apart to see if it could be repaired. The ceramic body of the faucet had a crack almost all the way around it. Wrote to the company and they would not give a refund, and the window to return it to Amazon has closed. Was not sure I could submit this review without giving at least 1 star. Really preferred to give none. Definitely would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Kujan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and performance
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded our kitchen and wanted a new faucet. This one looked better than the others and saved us a trip to Low-Depot. When it arrived, it clearly was better quality than the D**** one that we recently installed in the old house's kitchen. Love the way that it works. Doesn't splash all over the place, and if you activate the sprayer, it reverts to steady stream when you shut if off. No surprises.
customer_reviews.author: Hundedrek

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL !!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I do not have words fitting enough to express how wonderful and beautiful and functional this faucet is! I love it! Easy to install, matches all my stainless perfectly, and is simply gorgeous!!! I was elated to discover how handy it is to be able to stretch across the counter and fill my Kurieg coffee machine. Life made simple. Don't know what I was thinking with the last goose neck from the big store-plastic parts cracked and it leaked. So happy to find this one-seems to be all metal. Reviews helped my decision, hope this helps yours.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent faucet for kitchen sink
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an older style two piece faucet and sprayer with this pull-out faucet, and we love it. We've had it about 2 years now and it does not show any signs of wear. It gives a strong, but not intense, spray. It is easy to switch from normal stream to spray. The handle controls temperature and flow accurately. Great faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H. Glew

customer_reviews.title: Almost gets the job done nicely and costs under a $100.
customer_reviews.text: The faucet installed easily and fit into place nicely. We have a window behind the sink and this faucet doesn't stick up into the view very much. On the other hand there are 3 problems with this faucet. The spray mechanism is hard to operate and the spray mode doesn't always shut off when the water is turned off. Thirdly the weight of the handle will shut the faucet off automatically, an inconvenience when washing/rinsing dishes. For a cheaply made in China faucet for under a $100 it is OK just not great. Hopefully it will last 5 years before we have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Vermont Irish

customer_reviews.title: NIce looking faucet that's easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: After looking at some of the fancier more pricier faucets I decided to go with this one mostly because it was similar to our old Price Pfister faucet that lasted us almost 20 years until the hose popped off when the metal hose covering unraveled. Hopefully this will last as long or even longer. It is a nice looking faucet and easy to install. The all metal body seems to be well constructed while the head itself is made of plastic but what isn't these days? Will I purchase again? Look for an update in 20 years to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love the faucet, but two months after it was installed, it started to separate completely at the joint where it pulls out to reach corners of the sink. Water streams out and hits me in the face! I am able to reconnect it but it keeps happening. It does not seem to reconnect completely. Not sure if it is a product defect or a problem with the installation.
customer_reviews.author: Jane M.

customer_reviews.title: Replaced older same model- should use plumber who can check incoming water pressure
customer_reviews.text: This newer model does not seem to have pressure that older model had even tho plumber set the incoming water pressure higher- but is still a nice replacement-it does come with all needed parts!
customer_reviews.author: MumMum9

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE GARBAGE!!!!  AVOID!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a complete piece of junk! The base came unscrewed as I was hand tightening the nut from underneath and the threads are stripped. I cannot get it to reattach. And since I didn't install it right away my 30 days have passed and now I've wasted nearly $90 on this useless paperweight. Oh, and the instructions that came with it were HORRIBLE. Stay away from this thing unless you enjoy being frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ward

customer_reviews.title: This one seems to be made better, so I'm hopeful it will last more than ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced one that looked identical to it in my RV as it had essentially fell apart. This one seems to be made better, so I'm hopeful it will last more than 3 years, unlike its predecessor. Where the old one had plastic fittings, this one's were brass. Everything on it feels much more solid, too. I got a deal on prime day on this for ~ $60 so I felt like it was a good deal. I'm not sure I would have if it was much higher.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Faucet for the money
customer_reviews.text: It was more difficult to remove the old faucet than to install this new one. Great mounting design that will allow a faster replacement down the line if ever needed. Water flow and angle of spray are both very good. It is beautiful in appearance and much cheaper than all the others that I considered. I made the correct decision to purchase this one.
customer_reviews.author: >Wildbill 1998

customer_reviews.title: Low Water Pressure
customer_reviews.text: The faucet looks good but the water pressure is horribly low. Easily half the pressure of my previous faucet. I figured I would try it for a couple of weeks before making a final decision about replacing it. After 3 weeks I decided it will have to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: L. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Now that the installation is complete the faucet work fine!!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately Amazon was give the wrong spec's on this faucet that cost me an extra $15.00 for 3/8 to 1/2 inch adapters to complete the installation. Now that the installation is complete the faucet work fine!!
customer_reviews.author: Frog

customer_reviews.title: initially good.....lost pressure after a few weeks.....now super annoying!
customer_reviews.text: We had this installed for only a few weeks before the pressure completely went. You can barely get the spray to stay in bc it requires a little more pressure. I really liked the faucet initially. All other water pressure in house is fine. Now it takes me FOREVER to fill up sink to do dishes, it's really annoying and this wasn't exactly easy to install, so not looking forward to having to buy another! Any helpful hints on how to fix this problem???????
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: For this style of faucet, so far it has performed as expected. We have it in the nickel finish. No problems installing it. As to its longevity, that remains to be seen. Our water here is very hard and corrosive. That last faucet lasted about 7 years before it was literally eaten away.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: It's a decent faucet for the price
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and has no leaks from its components so far after about a month of usage. Moving parts has very light touch. I prefer a bit heavier. Its finish shows a little bit of cheapness like a black plastic pull-out handle holder is somewhat loose. Our old faucet which we replaced looked like an original one when they built this house in 1987, but I have a feeling that this Premier won't last that long. It's a decent faucet for the price.
customer_reviews.author: sy

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet at at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Faucet was simple to install and looks good. It fits very tight against the sink with no play. This is due to the hardware included which allows tightening of the faucet to the sink with the use of a screwdriver. The faucet has a hefty feel to it and it operates smoothly. Easy to switch between stream and spray. Overall, I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: DiBaccio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Faucet purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We're quite pleased with this Premier Faucet. We've had and used it for about a month and its totally worry free, totally! Installing in our RV took a little longer due to limited work space under counter, but all inlet fittings tighten up perfectly, no leaks, not a drop! Simply put? This faucet is looking and working perfect for us. Was a very affordable unit considering the beauty, easy clean up shiny surfaces and quality construction. Pretty darn happy we saved some money by not purchasing a more expensive model we viewed. To date, its everything and more we hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Amo

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely balanced design and function in a replacement faucet of ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely balanced design and function in a replacement faucet of this reasonable price range. Faucet water flow is ideal and angled for optimum use throughout the sink basin. Sprayer head use is strong and doesn't result in overspray water outside the sink. Nice chrome finish. Size is balanced and proportional in appearance. Installation is comparatively easy when using braided flex supply lines. Nice upgrade without having to spend $300 for some other overly ornate and odd faucet fixture.
customer_reviews.author: B Hill

customer_reviews.title: Premier Sonoma Lead-Free Pull-Out Faucet
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with it. it provided me with more water pressure saving me half the time now. The sprayer is great for washing my hair also. I am able to do it much quicker than before and it is a blessing not to have to have my head down in the sink as long. I have breathing difficulties so this has really helped me. Thank you for a beautiful, timesaving faucet.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: works and looks great
customer_reviews.text: We installed this directly into a granite counter top. We use the faucet itself without the long base and it looks fantastic. One thing should be noted, if you like the shower spray on it which you can switch to with a press of a button, it will automatically reset to the regular faucet spray when you turn off the water. So if you like it on shower setting all the time you will need to press the button every time you turn off the water. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: D Farr

customer_reviews.title: Needs a stronger spray to be functional, but otherwise decent.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars except the water pressure on the sprayer is sad, even though other sprayers put on the same sink have lots more strength. We have good water pressure at our house. The point is to rinse off dishes faster without wasting so much clean water. This one wastes a lot of water because it takes so long to accomplish this. For other things, where you don't need a stronger flow of water, it works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Doris O. Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Faucet Install
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived on Tim. Good design, excellence finish. The directions were a little short on information. Lots of pictures but most so small a little hard to interpret. Installation was fairly quick and easy due to a couple of quick connect hookups. The main shaft used a quick adjustment lock nut. Great improvement over trying to get a basin wrench in behind sink and wall.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Senecaut

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: 2016 Update: We ordered this in May 2015 and today May 2016 it started leaking from the neck right above the bottom plate, where the angled spout connects to the main column. Made a big mess in the kitchen. Only lasted one year! 2015 Perfect. We love the look, the water pressure/flow, and the height worked out perfectly as its under the shelf above the sink. It also shipped within 2 days. We're very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Manny Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good product. It was a nice upgrade from a ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. It was a nice upgrade from a regular faucet and sprayer. Easy to install, it took two people and about five minutes. Helpful to have someone hold it in place f4rom the top while you tighten it down. It seems like a medium to high "grade" of materials. It functions as it should and looks nice, just not quite a 5 star item. Great price though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The faucet is leaking internally. It cost me two plumber visit already. The manufacturer says they don't replace faucets, I would have to tell them which part is leaking - but the plumber says it needs to be replaced. We`re talking less than two months after installation. Giant ripoff, horrible customer service!!! Don`t order from them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Kitchen Sink Faucet
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fine working faucet. Well designed and well made. It was easy to install. It delivers a nicely aerated stream of water with either the stream or the spray setting. Shutting the water off resets the switch to the stream. There are others that look the same, but I'm very glad I bough this model. Excellent quality. The water control is a bit more coarse than I expected. Moving the handle a small amount makes a big difference. That took some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Dubuc

customer_reviews.title: Replacement required due to defect in the original faucet
customer_reviews.text: I like this faucet, but I had to return the first one purchased as it was defective. Unfortunately that meant paying 2x for installation by a plumbing firm which was very expensive. So far the second unit is OK and works well.
customer_reviews.author: auditjane

customer_reviews.title: Holding up great after almost a year.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while now, wanted to wait to review until I put it through some paces. It's holding up really nicely and I expect to be using it for years. The quality is great, install was a little difficult but its a funky faucet and they all have their quirks. It wipes clean really easily no matter what i get on it, grease from working outside to dried spaghetti sauce. I will be looking at this brand again when I need more faucets.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: My 17 year old nephew installed it and he did a great job and said it was very easy
customer_reviews.text: I got this faucet to replace a very torn op faucet in my kitchen. I was a little skeptical but reading reviews really helped me to make my decision. My 17 year old nephew installed it and he did a great job and said it was very easy. I've had this faucet for almost six months and it's still running good. I love the face that it has the shower head mode or whatever you call it. We'll see how long it lasts but for now it's working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel T.

customer_reviews.title: love my new faucet
customer_reviews.text: love my new faucet. good pressure. I like that it will pull out and I don't have to use the spray function. I can pull the hose out and fill a pitcher with a regular stream or I can use the spray function without pulling the hose out. it is multi functioning. It is so much better than a side pull out sprayer. it seemed fairly easy to install. the "handy man" I hired had no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Mis-leading Ad
customer_reviews.text: This product is not as advertised. The ad clearly says it'tsflow rate is 2.2 gpm but the box clearly states the max is 1.8 gpm. On top of that, the hot water comes out slower then that. I'm returning this and recommend Amazon review their advertising policies.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS out the bottom when the handle is lifted.
customer_reviews.text: Spent considerable time and effort installing in a very tight sink location. Turned on supply valves and there were no leaks. Got out from under the sink and lifted the handle. This caused water to spray out of the bottom of the faucet into the cabinet. The leak is inside the faucet not at the pull-out hose connection. I then had to remove this piece of junk, make a quick trip to Home Depot to get a similar looking Delta (50 bucks more) which installed with no leaks. If you buy this it would be wise to test before performing a difficult installation.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Although not thrilled with the style and the water flow isn't as strong as I woupd like, it easily fits in the cramped space I have and works well so far (2 days after install).
customer_reviews.author: Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this faucet for the price. Easy to install, looks and works great and it's still going strong after almost a year. No need at all to be spending a fortune in a big box store for a faucet, get this one, I love it. We installed the base with it at first but it seemed like a loose fit so we redid it without the base, it's much tighter and perfect. My advice - save time - don't install the base, besides, it looks much nicer without it.
customer_reviews.author: lexlobochip

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this faucet that long yet, but I really love it so far.....It is not made cheap. Best faucet we have had.....No problems so far. I will update at a later date... UPDATE December 27th, 2014 I am still loving the faucet. The only minor annoyance is if you try and turn the faucet down too far for a smaller stream, it totally goes off by itself. So far, the is the only thing I don't like about it. It is holding up great...
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: the first faucet was defected, but after making contact ...
customer_reviews.text: the first faucet was defected, but after making contact and getting a replacement item within a weeks time, the second installation went smooth and the faucet was fault free. So just for the inconvenience of have to wait on the replacement and my husband having to do 2 installations the rates as okay
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Not a great quality piece, but very nice for the price. We purchased this to replace our old standard faucet because we are putting our house on the market to sell. It looks very nice, and I LOVE the pull out sprayer. It's not high quality like you would find with a few other well known brands, but if you aren't destructive, this should last quite a long time. Definitely worth it if you want a cheaper option to upgrade your kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Feagans3

customer_reviews.title: Real good faucet for a modifiable price.
customer_reviews.text: Great faucet , great price. Replaced a fairly new one in place that I was never able to control the water temperature. It was burning my hands once in a while. I was able to use this Sonoma at a place I rented on my vacations and I knew already before I bought it that was real good. I ordered it from there and when I returned installed it myself without any major inconveniences. It has been working since then. No leaks or any other imperfections. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Hernan

customer_reviews.title: Problematic spray handle sleeve
customer_reviews.text: Maybe its just bad luck, but the faucet I received would not tighten down correctly. The spray handle sleeve (where the spray handle inserts) wobbled in place. I chose to return this less expensive unit in favor of a a better made, more expensive one.
customer_reviews.author: Babci

customer_reviews.title: Love this faucet
customer_reviews.text: Love this faucet.. Works beautifully... I had it installed only 2 weeks ago but the pressure is wonderful and looks beautiful with my stainless steel sink Updated Review: It has been 3 years since I've had it and the nickel on the sprayer seems to be discoloring. It makes me upset because it doesn't look so nice anymore. Hoping I can buy a new sprayer without have to replace the whole faucet. Bummed!
customer_reviews.author: G.G. Washington

customer_reviews.title: lasted 16 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought 16 months ago and now it leaks. Replaced a 15 years old cheap faucet that lasted 15 years. Was professionally installed but now I'm SOL. Nice while it worked. Always felt lighter and cheaper than other faucets I've owned. We rent now and did not spend what we've spent when we owned our own place. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: rustyredcab

customer_reviews.title: No more burn outs
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase thus far! I have owned and have used for almost a month. I went with this faucet because I was having to buy new faucets every two years due to the fact that I have very hot water that continues to melt or burn out the plastic that the other lesser quality faucets internal mechanisms were made of. I am hoping to have this faucet for a much longer time. Time will tell. Love the appearance, very classy and functional.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet, love the features.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife to upgrade the kitchen a little bit, and she absolutely loves it. We did have it installed by a professional plumber to ensure that all the fittings were snugged correctly, and didn't have any leakage issues. I'm happy to say the faucet has been in service since we got it, and we're still using it today. It's easy to clean, the pull out faucet is great, and pushes plenty of water for doing dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Grey Mist

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was good at first but only lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: Installed this at a rental property and the tenants love it. Say its good quality and works well. looks as depicted. Update: Lowering rating. The faucet has been installed a year and my tenants told me when they left that it would not stay on. A kitchen remodel proved it too far gone to re-use. Terrible lifetime of a year.
customer_reviews.author: River

customer_reviews.title: Good pricing and solid
customer_reviews.text: I spent much time reading reviews of many products from different manufacturers.This faucet is priced right, looks good and has more of a solid feel than many of the well known other brands which cost twice as much.. One trip to the hardware store and matter of fact installation. Everything works great and the water pressure is terrific. Time will tell if the product can hold up!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but loose
customer_reviews.text: It is nice looking, but it feels a little loose/ sloppy in the neck area. Maybe because it needs to be able to rotate. But, there doesn't seem to be a way to tighten it up at all. Because of the looseness, it feels like it's going to come out. If I were to do this over, I woildn't buy this without actually seeing it. It does blend well with my stainless steel sink.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Price

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the faucet
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the faucet. It is of good quality and not like others that I looked at locally at the home improvement center and local stores for the same price or even higher. I would definitely recommend it. Can't speak for the other faucets this manufacturer makes, but I know that this one is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kat's Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This faucet worked great for maybe 5 months. Then all of a sudden the faucet wouldn't stay 'on' unless it was turned on all the way, otherwise the faucet turns itself off which is very annoying and not practical.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K. Vitto

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Moen that gave us quite a few headaches. Took 9 years but I finally decided time to buy new. Faucets are not easy to buy worrying about size and fittings. I was skeptical, especially since I was going install this myself. What a breeze to install. Took two hours and 75 minutes of that was trying to get out the old Moen. Well made and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: BigAl64

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: this product was defective when my very experienced builder and plumber tried to install. the threads wouldn't connect despite their careful attempts. Their recommendation was to go with another product as they view this problem as more than an one off defect.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet at a great price
customer_reviews.text: A great little faucet at a fantastic price. It has the ceramic disks and is well made. I researched brands and the experts say it is no longer the "name" that matters, it is the components the faucet is made with. Many "no name" brands are going to be as good and last as long as the higher dollar equivalents. I have found this to be true and am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Denise B

customer_reviews.title: lovely
customer_reviews.text: So far we love this faucet! It was a little difficult for us to put in only because we have an old sink setup so we needed so pipe extenders put other than that it was easy to put in, moves from side to side easily, looks great has decent pressure so all together a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy installation, seems rock-solid
customer_reviews.text: Man, am I glad I spotted this gem. It replaced a pricey model that I once thought was the Standard for American faucets. Can’t yet vouch for down-the-road longevity, but I have a real good feeling after handling this tank during installation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works and looks brand new after a year.
customer_reviews.text: still looks and works brand new after a year. I have six kids and 2 grand kids. My house should be the tester kitchen as we are hard on everything. I bought this a year ago when mine went out that came with the house. i looked at many reviews and prices. just wanted a good reliable faucet. No problems so far. I would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: discrepancys

customer_reviews.title: Premier Tap
customer_reviews.text: WOW WOW WOW!!!! I just love my new tap. It had given my sink and amazing makeover. The look is Stella. The materials are of a very high standard and it works amazingly well. My plumber said I picked well. He liked it a lot and was able to install it in no time. All the features work really well. Happy with this product. It was well packed and Its a winner tap!!!! BUY IT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah  Jane

customer_reviews.title: Premier 120158LF Sonoma Kitchen Faucet - Like it!
customer_reviews.text: Great features for the price, unpretentious, solidly built, classic copper tube hook-up (hot & cold), easy to install and NO LEAKS. I installed this last month to replace a higher cost Kohler faucet that had leak issues- it was only a few months old. You need to buy the correct braided SS steel flex hoses (not included), but my having control of that feature is possibly another reason why there are NO LEAKS. Thank you Premier!
customer_reviews.author: D. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Good basic faucet
customer_reviews.text: Nice finish. Although the base metal plate is not at all water spot resistant. Always looks dirty unless you wipe it clean. Can't beat it for the price. Similar ones at the store were around $50 more. Water comes out with much more force than our old faucet. So we don't have to turn it up all the way to get same amount of force.
customer_reviews.author: P. Shah

customer_reviews.title: Installation
customer_reviews.text: Only hard part was getting the old one off. This is well worth getting, easiest faucet I ever installed and works great, if it lasts as long as the old one I will be one happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: The pull-out hose broke and would no longer retract during the second use of pull-out. I was waiting for the plumber to come and fix it but he had injured his back. Between the time it took to get it installed and the time it took for him to come back to look at it and tell me I needed a replacement, the return period had passed.
customer_reviews.author: EC AC

customer_reviews.title: Flow Problems
customer_reviews.text: you may experience a low flow after installation. This is caused by a restriction in the hose for the faucet... it is part of the hose under the sink, it has to be removed..; I got this info from the manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: RFM

customer_reviews.title: Still Works Great (2+ years)
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I've not had any issues. I ordered and installed this item about two years ago. Admittedly, I did install the 'hot' and 'cold' lines switched... I just pulled off the little red and blue rubber thing and turned it over. 2+ years.. no problems.
customer_reviews.author: That Murphy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the sturdiness of this faucet. I wouldn't hesitate to buy another and for sure better than any of the other faucets at the home improvement stores in this price range. My only qualm is the spray setting only really works at full water pressure and switches back to stream if turned down much at all.
customer_reviews.author: pinky

customer_reviews.title: Good faucet for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This really is a very good faucet for the money. Let's face it, you can not compare it to a $400 faucet, but having replaced expensive faucets all too often in the past, I'm not willing to pay the big bucks for another one. This faucet is solid, very easy to install, and works perfectly. Can't ask for anything more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Looks good with older SS sink.
customer_reviews.text: Got this replace a faucet that croaked, it was a low end Moen. So far, it is great. My husband is handy, so the bad directions didn't hold him up much. Had it a month, I have adjusted to having one that works well. I will try to update in a year, and see how it is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid brass faucet
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid brass faucet. Replaced a more expensive metallized plastic one. Need flexible couplings to connect to piping unlike tmy old one that had the couplings as part of the faucet. The solid brass construction should retain its shape unlike the plastic one that tends to wear out and cause the nozzle part to not seat properly. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: K. Leong

customer_reviews.title: Defective????
customer_reviews.text: Mine may be defective. It doesn't flip to turn off the spray. The spray button is difficult to use - even to turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: Anne M.

customer_reviews.title: Cant get hot water anymore. Let it run for ...
customer_reviews.text: Cant get hot water anymore. Let it run for 10 minutes and water only gets luke warm. Don't know what to do.Instructions don't show any kind of adjustment
customer_reviews.author: Dorian

customer_reviews.title: Very nice faucet, easy install and then metal hose for ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice faucet, easy install and then metal hose for the sprayer extension is definitely a step-up from the non-metallic ones that tend to fray. I would recommend this to anybody who wishes to stay within a lower budget but also doesn't want to replace the faucet within two years. Well done Sonoma!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lopez (Avid Buyer, Reader & Judge of Goods & Services)

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet for the price and looks just as good ...
customer_reviews.text: Great faucet for the price and looks just as good as the Moen I replaced. I love the versatility of being able to rotate the faucet between sinks. I had it installed for $175. Yep I would buy another Premier Sonoma.
customer_reviews.author: CucamongaSeanny

customer_reviews.title: could use better settings.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, it looks good, downside is that depending on the water pressure the shower/rinse type setting changes to full blast if the water pressure becomes low. Installation was a breeze but better instructions should be included. let's see how long this last. This is replacing an old moen faucet.
customer_reviews.author: juice25

customer_reviews.title: Great Faucet
customer_reviews.text: Only installed this last weekend, but what an improvement over the old one we'd been using for the last 5 years. Installation was fairly simple as well. Instructions were maybe a little lacking, but it's certainly not "rocket surgery" installing a kitchen faucet. You can find many videos on the web that can be helpful, and they don't need to be for the same model faucet as they're all relatively similar.
customer_reviews.author: Phillygpz

customer_reviews.title: Chrome model has plastic parts
customer_reviews.text: Important to note that the Chrome product uses plastic parts. I now realize that most of the posted "good reviews" for this product were for the STAINLESS model, which I wish I had known before choosing the inferior CHROME version.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Better quality than higher-priced ones at local building supply stores
customer_reviews.text: Got this installed a month or so ago and LOVE IT. It's nice looking and works fine. I was especially appreciative of the manufacturer including an extra round filler plate because my sink had four holes so that extra plate was a bonus. I'm confident it will do as advertised and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until it started leaking.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. Until it started leaking from the cold side (not the supply line connection) after only one year. Who wants to replace a faucet every year!?
customer_reviews.author: T99J

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This was half the cost of the faucets at the big box stores. We have had it installed for almost 6 months and it works great! Looks great too. Doesn't have all the bells and whistles or touch off/on but we couldn't be happier with our choice. Why would someone pay top dollar for a name brand faucet? Unless you sell faucets or are buying one, no one looks for the name brand. Save your money and buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Brian R.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied. Really nice hardware.
customer_reviews.text: This faucet is very nice. It installed easily and looks great. Our water pressure/flow has never been this good with previous hardware. It's all metal fixtures as well, no cheap plastic parts that will break.
customer_reviews.author: Roger E.

product_meta.title: Premier 120161LF Sonoma Single-Handle Kitchen Faucet with Pull-Out Spout, Brushed Nickel
product_meta.description:
Single metal lever handle all brass construction with lead-free waterways dual function pull-out spout ceramic disc cartridge for trouble-free performance provides flow rate of 22 gpm at 60 psi switch from stream to spray with the touch of a button suitable for single-hole or three-hole installations includes optional deck plate for three-hole mount 1/2 inch ips connections ADA compliant.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Enjoy the convenience of a pull-out spout sprayer with contemporary design. With a generous 48-Inch retractable hose, the Sonoma pull-out kitchen faucet provides you with the freedom to wash, rinse, or clean wherever you need to reach. Premier's ceramic disc technology ensures consistent, leak-free performance for the life of your faucet. Solid lead-free brass construction provides robust durability and strength. One of Premier's perennial best sellers, this Sonoma pull-out kitchen faucet can be installed on one-hole or three-hole sinks. It includes an optional brushed nickel deck plate for three-hole applications. You can install this on a four-hole sink and add a Premier soap dispenser (sold separately, Premier 552029) to match the finish of the Sonoma kitchen faucet. This Sonoma kitchen faucet features a brushed nickel finish, a solid metal lever handle for precise temperature and volume control, and can deliver a steady stream or powerful spray of water at the touch of a button. This faucet provides a flow rate of 2.2 gallons per minute. It complies with the requirements of the Uniform Plumbing Code and the Americans with Disabilities Act. This Premier faucet is also listed with the International Association of Plumbing Officials, the Uniform Plumbing Code, the Canadian Standards Association, and the National Sanitation Foundation. It includes Premier's Limited Lifetime Warranty. This faucet meets the strict lead-free requirements of California and Vermont.
feature_bullets: Powerful stream at a rate of of 2.2 GPM
Strong all-brass construction with lead-free waterways
Single metal lever handle for water temperature and flow control
Wear-resistant ceramic disc for leak-free operation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars506 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
